data.title: Unable to disable "memory mapped IO above 4 GB" bios option
data.meta_description: Hi, I've a Dell T3610 workstation which has following CPU. Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-1607 v2 @ 3.00GHz I've plugged in a Broadcom XLP pcie card
data.text:
Hi,

I've a Dell T3610 workstation which has following CPU.

Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-1607 v2 @ 3.00GHz

I've plugged in a Broadcom XLP pcie card into PCIe Gen-3 x16 slot of this Dell machine.

In bios, I want to disable the "memory mapped IO above 4 GB" option.

When I uncheck this option, click on "Apply", exit from bios and reenter it,

I see that the "memory mapped IO above 4 GB" option is again enabled (checked).

If I remove the aforementioned pcie card, then, however, I'm able to disable

"memory mapped IO above 4 GB" option in bios.

Could someone please tell me how to disable this option with the pcie card still plugged in ?

Thanks,

Siva Krishna.
